intro: Rinorea cuspa, commonly known as the velvet leaf or velvet plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, fragrant flowers are typically white or pale pink and bloom in clusters. Rinorea cuspa is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of cultivation.
